doc.title: Hainan Jinpan (A)
doc.source_uri: 2025-08-29/Benefits from rising AIDC-related demand and solid export growth lift PO to RMB68Benefits from rising AIDC-related deman_2025-08-29

passages.text: Reiterate Rating: BUY | PO: 68.00 CNY | Price: 58.85 CNY

When we initiated coverage on Jinpan, we highlighted its special edge in AIDC (see our initiation report). The AI infra chain has rallied over the past few months, driven by the capex raise from domestic and US ISPs and CSPs. Jinpan saw \(461\%\) YoY revenue growth from data centers in 1H25 and completed the SST sample recently. We estimate its \(0 / 0\) of earnings from data centers to reach \(20\%\) in 2026 ( \(7\%\) in 2024). Meanwhile, the largely eased concern about US- China tariff and launch of its Malaysia factory could also help support its US orders (export revenue \(+11\%\) YoY in 1H25). We raise our 2025- 27E EPS by \(5 - 25\%\) on higher revenue and margin estimates. We switch our valuation methodology to SOTP (from P/E) given the rising \(0 / 0\) of earnings from AIDC. We assign \(68x\) P/E to AIDC segment and \(22x\) P/E to non- AIDC segment (in line with that for power equipment peers). As such, we raise our PO to RMB68 (from RMB37). The implied blended P/E is \(31x\) ( \(23x\) previously), 0.55D above the historical average level to reflect the upcycle of the AI infra chain. We reiterate Buy.

Compared to its domestic peers, Jinpan has faster progress in lining up with internet & cloud service customers (i.e., Alibaba, Baidu, ByteDance, etc.) thanks to its edge in dry- type transformers. We estimate Jinpan's revenue from data- center- related customers to account for \(20\%\) of total revenue in 2026 ( \(7\%\) in 2024), driven by 1) rising demand from capex expansion among ISPs and CSPs ( \(46\%\) CAGR over 2023- 26E); 2) Jinpan's sufficient capacity; and 3) the company's R&D efforts for new products. In 1H25, Jinpan's revenue from data center customers surged by \(461\%\) YoY, well proving its edge in AIDC supply chain and management's strong execution capability.

Jinpan has the highest \(0 / 0\) of overseas revenue among our covered power equipment companies ( \(29\%\) in 2024). We estimate its overseas revenue CAGR at \(40\%\) over 2024- 27E (vs. \(18\%\) for domestic revenue) with \(0 / 0\) of revenue reaching \(40\%\) in 2027E. This should be driven by the rising demand from overseas market (7M25 transformer export value \(+37\%\) YoY); and 2) Jinpan's edge in overseas, in particular, the US market.

Key Metrics \\* For full definitions of iQmethod measures, see page 10.
Electrical Equipment

Jinpan is a leading power equipment provider in China. The company mainly focuses on dry-type transformers and has a diversified customer base. Jinpan is also one of the few domestic companies able to enter US market.

We appreciate Jinpan's solid fundamentals (i.e., resilient share gain over past three years, diversified client base, breakthrough in US market and shorter delivery period). We also expect it to be one of the major beneficiaries from the robust development of AI, which requires more dry type transformers. We thus have a Buy rating

Power equipment is essential to ensure reliable power supply and stable data center operations. We see rising demand for power distribution equipment (transformers) and power quality equipment. Meanwhile, major internet and cloud companies in China and US are expanding their capex plan, given the rapid development. Our China internet team forecasts the budget of Top-5 internet companies to grow at a 46% CAGR over 2023-26E.
US players also raised capex plan post the 2025 results. Based on our US team's

forecast, the total capex for four leading internet & cloud companies in US will rise by 60% in 2025E, followed by another 25% YoY growth in 2026E. This translates into rising demand for power equipment, and provides opportunities for China manufacturers who have more sufficient capacity and a shorter lead time vs. global peers.
Increasing capex from leading internet and cloud companies could lead to higher data center demand and thus better demand outlook for Montage's interconnect chips
Source: Companies, Bloomberg, (*) BofA Global Research estimates; Note: Alibaba capex is adjusted to calendar year accordingly
BofA GLOBAL RESEARCH
Capex for major internet & could companies in US will increase 46% CAGR over 2023-26E
Source: Company data, BofA Global Research

We are also positive on the export growth rate, given the still rising demand from overseas market (renewable energies, replacement demand & AIDC demand). Indeed, the surging demand and urgency of spending has tightened supply chains, increased lead times on critical equipment. For instance, the lead time for major US & Europe equipment providers is up to c.2.5 years vs. <1 years for China suppliers.
In 1H25, the total export value of transformers/high-voltage switches grew 36%/31% YoY, respectively. Looking into full-year 2025, we estimate the export value of transformers to grow by >20% YoY.

Jinpan is a leading transformer provider in China with the highest exposure to AIDC customers among power equipment peers (7% of revenue in 2024). It is also one of the few Chinese players with an edge in the US market, enabling it to benefit from rising capex from internet & cloud services providers in China and the US.

In 2024, Jinpan's new orders from domestic data centers rose \(604\%\) YoY, mainly due to contributions from ByteDance, Baidu, Alibaba, China Mobile, China Unicom etc. Meanwhile, the company is expanding its capacity for data- center- related products (VPI transformers, power sources etc.). The edge in dry- type transformers, early- mover advantage among data center customers, and expanding capacity, should well support its revenue growth from data center customers. We estimate its data- center- related revenue to grow at a \(96\%\) CAGR over 2024- 27E and reach RMB3.4bn in 2027E, representing \(25\%\) of its total revenue.
Exhibit 10: Jinpan's revenue from data centers
Source: Company data, BofA Global Research
Exhibit 11: Net profit growth of Jinpan We estimate Jinpan's earnings to grow by \(27\%\) CAGR over 2024-27E
Source: Company data, BofA Global Research

We estimate Jinpan's net profit to grow by \(23\% /42\% /19\%\) YoY in 2025/26/27E on the back of 1) sufficient orders on hand (order CAGR \(30\%\) over 2021- 24); 2) resilient export growth (40% export value CAGR over 2024- 27E); and 3) surging revenue from data- center- related customers. We lift our 2025/26/27E earnings by \(5\% /25\% /22\%\) due to a more positive outlook for export growth and demand from data center customers.
We switch our valuation methodology to SOTP (was P/E) as we believe the rising % of earnings from AIDC (20% in 2026E vs. \(7\%\) in 2024) deserve more credit. Its AIDC peers
BofA GLOBAL RESEARCH

are trading at 68x 2026E P/E and its domestic/overseas power equipment peers are trading at 20x/22x 2026E P/E. We assign 68x P/E to AIDC segment (largely in line with AIDC infra peers' average level) and 22x P/E to non-AIDC segment (largely in line with our target P/E for other power equipment peers). As such, we raise our PO to RMB68 (was RMB37). The implied blended P/E is 31x (was 23x), 0.55D above the historical average level to reflect the upcycle of the AI infra chain.

We take Megmeet, Envicool, and Shenling as Jinpan's peers for AIDC segment, as they are major suppliers for AI infrastructure.

- Megmeet is a leading power source supplier in China. We estimate its revenue exposure in AIDC to be in mid-single digit in 2026.- Envicool is a leading provider of precision cooling and energy-saving solutions and products in China.- Shenling manufactures diversified precious cooling/thermal management products for data centers and other sectors. It is a tier-1 cooling facility supplier of Huawei's supply chain.- Jinpan is China's leading dry-type transformer company. Its products are more suitable for data centers. Jinpan is also one of the few China transformer suppliers able to enter the US market, enabling it to benefit from the rising demand in China and the US. We estimate its % of earnings from AIDC to rise to 20% in 2026.

For domestic power equipment peers, we take these companies as benchmark: NARI (comprehensive grid equipment supplier), Sieyuan (leading private owned enterprise grid equipment supplier with edge in high voltage products and exports), China XD (leading state owned grid equipment supplier focusing on transformers and switch), XJ Electric (comprehensive grid equipment supplier with edge in ultra-high voltage products) and Huaming (leading tap changer manufacturer in global market).

For global peers, we take these companies as benchmark: giant and comprehensive power equipment supplier in Europe (Siemens, Schneider, ABB, Prysmian), leading power equipment supplier in US (Eaton), comprehensive power equipment player in Japan (Hitachi) as well as leading players in South Korea (HD Hyundai Electric and LS Electric).
Exhibit 15: Valuation summary for power equipment peers & AIDC peers Jinpan is trading at 27x 2026E P/E, below AIDC peers (68x)
Source: Company data, BofA Global Research; Price date: 27 August 2025
Exhibit 16: Summary of major changes We raise 2025/26/27E earnings by \(5\% /25\% /22\%\)
Source: Company data, BofA Global Research

We assign 68x P/E to its AIDC segment (in- line with AIDC infra peer's average level) and 22x P/E to non- AIDC segment (in line with power equipment peers). As such, we have PO to RMB68. The implied blended P/E is 31x, 0.55D above historical avg. level to reflect upcycle of Al infra chain.

Downside risk: higher US/Europe tariff and trade disputes, slower pace of launching new overseas factories, fierce competition in low voltage transformer market, higher material cost, slower booking schedule.
Upside risk: lower tariff level, higher margin level and faster booking schedule.
